articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli Army Radio said on Saturday its military had targeted Hamas' military chief in a strike on Khan Younis in Gaza, in a strike that the enclave's health ministry said had killed at least 20 Palestinians.
articles.title: Israeli army radio says Hamas military chief targeted in Gaza strike

articles.author: Sofia Christensen
articles.description: For Mariama Jarjou, taking her two daughters to a traditional circumciser when they were 5 and 4 was an act of love - a painful but important ritual that would give them status in their village and make them eligible for marriage.
articles.title: Insight: Gambia's bid to unban FGM divides families and parliament

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China expressed strong opposition on Saturday to a U.S. law signed by President Joe Biden that presses Beijing to resolve a dispute over Tibet's demands for greater autonomy, vowing to "firmly defend" its interests.
articles.title: China blasts US Tibet-China dispute bill, vows to defend its interests

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Taiwan's defence ministry said on Saturday it was monitoring "waves" of missile tests taking place in China's far northern region of Inner Mongolia and that its air defence forces were on alert.
articles.title: Taiwan on alert over 'waves' of missile tests in north China

articles.author: Ange Kasongo
articles.description: U.N. peacekeepers are unlikely to proceed with an agreed withdrawal from Congo's conflict-torn North Kivu for as long as Rwandan troops remain in the eastern province, the Congolese foreign minister said on Saturday.
articles.title: Congo says UN exit unlikely while Rwandan troops present

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Pakistan court acquitted former Prime Minister Imran Khan and his wife on Saturday on charges of unlawful marriage, his lawyer said.
articles.title: Pakistan court acquits ex-PM Imran Khan, wife in unlawful marriage case, lawyer says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The United Nations mission in Libya (UNSMIL) called on Saturday for the immediate release of a journalist detained in Tripoli two days ago, adding all media workers should be kept safe.
articles.title: UN mission to Libya calls for immediate release of detained journalist

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Polish coal miner trapped underground since Thursday was found alive by rescuers on Saturday, local media reported.
articles.title: Polish miner found alive after more than 48 hours trapped underground

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Four police officers were killed and at least three injured in clashes between Iraqi government forces and Islamic State militants in Diyala province in eastern Iraq on Saturday, police and medical sources said.
articles.title: Islamic State kills four police in clashes in eastern Iraq

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said his U.S counterpart Joe Biden accidentally referring to him as Russian President Vladimir Putin was a mistake that could be forgotten about given all the support the U.S. has provided to Ukraine.
articles.title: 'It's a mistake,' Zelenskiy says of Biden's Putin mix up
